Sun.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System, a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma that provides the necessary energy for life on Earth.
particular_traits: Composed mainly of hydrogen and helium

Mercury.description: The smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System, Mercury has a rocky surface with extreme temperature variations.

Venus.description: The second planet from the Sun, Venus has a thick atmosphere composed mainly of carbon dioxide, creating a runaway greenhouse effect.
particular_traits: Hottest planet in the Solar System
Rotates in the opposite direction of most planets
Has thick clouds of sulfuric acid

Earth.description: The third planet from the Sun, Earth is the only known celestial body to support life and has vast amounts of liquid water.
particular_traits: Atmosphere rich in oxygen and nitrogen

Mars.description: The fourth planet from the Sun, Mars is a cold desert world with the largest volcano and canyon in the Solar System.

Jupiter.description: The largest planet in the Solar System, Jupiter is a gas giant with a massive magnetic field and dozens of moons.
particular_traits: Strongest magnetic field of all planets

Saturn.description: The sixth planet from the Sun, Saturn is known for its prominent ring system and its numerous moons.

Uranus.description: The seventh planet from the Sun, Uranus is an ice giant with a unique tilt that causes extreme seasonal variations.
particular_traits: Mainly composed of water, ammonia, and methane

Neptune.description: The eighth and farthest planet from the Sun, Neptune is a deep blue ice giant with the strongest winds in the Solar System.
particular_traits: Coldest planet in the Solar System
Deep blue color due to methane in its atmosphere
